com.milk.command.gui
Class JCommandableMenu

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--javax.swing.JPopupMenu
                          |
                          +--com.milk.command.gui.JCommandableMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.MenuElement, java.io.Serializable
public final class JCommandableMenu
extends javax.swing.JPopupMenu

This class is a JPopupMenu subclass which is set up to track a Commandable's commands. The list of commands and their enabled state are reflected directly as the menu items in the popup menu. No explicit action should be taken to manipulate the item list.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.
See Also:
Commandable, Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
private  class JCommandableMenu.MyAction
          This is the class for all of the actions in the menu.
private  class JCommandableMenu.MyCommandableListener
          This is the listener to the commandable, used to add and remove items from the menu.
private  class JCommandableMenu.MyCommandListener
          This is the listener for all the commands, used to notice label and enabled changes.
